cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media changes how news and information are received and shared.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject changes or structures how the object is distributed, shared, or disseminated, without necessarily creating the object itself.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Social Media and Online Social Interaction
remarks: Information is broader than news, but news is the salient case here.
Information is broader than news, but news is the salient case here.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Citizen journalism contributes to the rapid spread of news.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject increases the speed, reach, or likelihood of the dissemination of the object information or content.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: User-generated content is a key factor in news spreading rapidly.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject increases the speed, reach, or likelihood of the dissemination of the object information or content.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: News propagates rapidly via social networking sites on social media platforms.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an information item is disseminated through a specific communication channel or medium.
remarks: Mapped social networking sites to the generic social media platforms entity.
Mapped social networking sites to the generic social media platforms entity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: News disseminated via social networking sites reaches a wider audience.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an information item reaches or becomes accessible to a specified audience or recipient group.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Social Media and Online Social Interaction

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: RelativeReach: larger than via traditional media outlets

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Traditional media outlets also reach an audience, but more slowly than news via social networking sites.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a communication channel or medium reaches or can access a particular audience.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Social Media and Online Social Interaction

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: RelativeSpeed: slower than via social networking sites

remarks: Relation created mainly to encode comparative reach implied for traditional outlets.
Relation created mainly to encode comparative reach implied for traditional outlets.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The way information is shared and spread results in the proliferation of rumors.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject causally contributes to a significant increase in the amount or spread of the object (e.g., content types such as rumors, conspiracy theories, or propaganda).
remarks: Rumors are implicitly treated as a particular problematic subset of the information being spread.
Rumors are implicitly treated as a particular problematic subset of the information being spread.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The mode of information sharing results in proliferation of conspiracy theories.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject causally contributes to a significant increase in the amount or spread of the object (e.g., content types such as rumors, conspiracy theories, or propaganda).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The way information spreads leads to proliferation of propaganda.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject causally contributes to a significant increase in the amount or spread of the object (e.g., content types such as rumors, conspiracy theories, or propaganda).

args.justification: Both relations describe citizen journalism and user-generated content causally contributing to faster or broader spreading of news. Their rel_hint_type is 'causal', and they are parallel in meaning to other instances already using rel_cls 'information_dissemination_causal_relation', so the class should explicitly reflect the causal nature rather than the more generic 'information_dissemination_relation'.

RelR_1f9e18a195ff encodes that traditional media outlets reach an audience, which is semantically parallel to RelR_860e8152d480 (news reaching a wider audience). To keep the schema consistent, both audience-reach edges should share the same broader class 'information_dissemination_relation' rather than splitting this single predicate into a separate 'audience_reach_relation' class used only once.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (an information item or communication channel) reaches or becomes accessible to a specified audience or recipient group.
args.justification: Both relations use the same canonical predicate 'reaches_audience' but currently have slightly different canonical_rel_desc wordings (one focused on information items, the other on communication channels). Unifying them under a single description that explicitly covers both types of subjects improves schema consistency and reuse of the predicate definition.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe citizen journalism and user-generated content causally contributing to faster or broader spreading of news. RelR_1f9e18a195ff encodes that traditional media outlets reach an audience, which is semantically parallel to RelR_860e8152d480 (news reaching a wider audience). To keep the schema consistent, both audience-reach edges should share the same broader class 'information_dissemination_relation' rather than splitting this single predicate into a separate 'audience_reach_relation' class used only once.

Unifying them under a single description that explicitly covers both types of subjects improves schema consistency and reuse of the predicate definition.
